meanings.definition: Able to be reversed or turned inside out.
meanings.sent1: The reversible jacket was truly invertible, offering two styles in one.
meanings.sent2: The inside-out umbrella was an invertible design that kept the rain away.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful nature made it seem invertible, always turning things around.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like an invertible maze, leading him in circles.
meanings.sent5: The plot twist in the story was as invertible as a double-sided coin, leaving readers guessing.
